items.text: short and just outside off, cut straight to point
items.shortText: Santner to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: length o off stump, punched to long-off
items.shortText: Santner to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 1 run

items.text: length outside off, driven back to the bowler on the up
items.shortText: Santner to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: full outside off, gets his front leg into the leg side and drives to sweeper cover
items.shortText: Santner to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
items.postText: Jimmy Jones: "I can hear Latham saying "down down down!" when there is a single or potential single. What does the "down" mean in this context?" --- Screaming at the fielder to get down at it quickly, I'd imagine.
items.shortText: Santner to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: Santner wins the battle! They're both intelligent cricketers, Santner and Mehidy. Mehidy's footwork was top-class so far and he was maneuvering Santner all over and picking him off. Almost as a pattern, all of Santner's sixth balls were quicker, but this time he hangs it up wide outside off on a length. Mehidy wants to sweep to the backward square boundary after shuffling, but his top-edge is easy for short fine to get to with a jog to the left. Neesham there
items.shortText: Santner to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, OUT

dismissal.text: Mehidy Hasan Miraz c Neesham b Santner 26 (27m 27b 3x4 1x6) SR: 96.29

items.text: short and wide outside off, left alone
items.shortText: Neesham to Mohammad Saifuddin, 1 wide

items.text: full and wide outside off, left alone
items.shortText: Neesham to Mohammad Saifuddin, 1 wide

items.text: short of a length and in at the thigh. Deflected behind square with an attempted flick
items.shortText: Neesham to Mohammad Saifuddin, 1 leg bye

items.text: length and just outside off. Gets behind the line and runs this to third man
items.shortText: Neesham to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.preText: Over the wicket to the left hander now
items.text: length at leg stump, rapped on the pads as he looks to defend
items.shortText: Neesham to Mohammad Saifuddin, no run

items.text: length ball shaping away outside off, left alone
items.shortText: Neesham to Mohammad Saifuddin, no run

items.text: length on leg stump, defended on the front foot
items.postText: Fred: "@Jimmy: it's a reminder to the fielder to get right down to the turf so the ball doesn't sneak under the hands or even worse, nutmeg. It sounds a bit obvious / silly but it does actually work (based on my experience at the high level of 4th grade club cricket)" --- Never seems to work for my team, Fred. Not sure if fielders are disobedient or incompetent.
items.shortText: Neesham to Mohammad Saifuddin, no run

items.text: overpitched on leg stump, beaten on the flick, cops it on the pad
items.postText: Saoirse: "Well we all know the adage of double the 30 over score. Bangladesh to finish on 270-14 anyone?"
items.shortText: Neesham to Mohammad Saifuddin, no run

items.text: full on leg stump, flicked to deep square

items.text: short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
items.postText: Adam: "Right, seven wickets down - time to bring Boult back."

items.text: short of a length on leg stump, clipped to deep square's right off the back foot
items.shortText: Santner to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: length and just outside off. Tapped to extra cover off the back foot
items.shortText: Santner to Mohammad Saifuddin, no run

items.text: length on off stump, dropped into the square leg region with soft hands
items.postText: Fred: "@Varun: my reminder to myself to 'watch the ball' just as the bowlers delivering never seems to work either. I wouldn't put that down to disobedience..."
items.shortText: Santner to Mohammad Saifuddin, 1 run

items.text: short and just outside off, zipping in. Arm ball. But he makes room by getting deep in the crease and chops this past point
items.shortText: Santner to Mohammad Mithun, FOUR runs

items.preText: Lockie, around the wicket with a slip and gully
items.text: top edge short of third man. Don't think Saifuddin has ever faced Lockie before, but that doesn't stop him from running down at him and heaving at it. Length ball, wide outside off. Can't control the attempted slog
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mohammad Saifuddin, 1 run

items.text: length outside off, jabs it down to third man
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: yorker just outside off, can't get his bat down quickly enough. It curves away marginally and beats the outside edge
items.postText: Brendan J : "Time to bring Bolt back to knock over the leftie before he gets his eye in. Saiffudin may be at no. 9 but he averages over 35 in FC cricket with a century to his name.. "
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mohammad Saifuddin, no run

items.text: length and just outside off. Defended to cover off the back foot
items.postText: sarat: "That slog by Saifuddin at 31.1 pretty much sums up the T20 mood that B'desh players are still in"
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mohammad Saifuddin, no run

items.text: shot! Supern fielding from Guptill at midwicket. Length and angled in at middle stump. Gets his head right on top of this with a half step forward. Flicks neatly with the angle but can't beat the dive
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mohammad Saifuddin, no run
